BioModel.name: CM_PM25628036_MB1::GEF_activation
BioModel.text: Activator degradation. The forward reaction rate parameter (k3) is assigned an arbitrary value (1 uM-1min-1).

guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF)- regulator of RhoGTPases. GEFs activate GTPases by promoting the exchange of GDP for GTP. GAPs inactivate GTPases by stimulating their intrinsic GTP-hydrolyzing activity.
guanine nucleotide exchange factors: Activate small G proteins by promoting exchange of GDP for GTP
Inactivation of GEF. The forward reaction rate parameter (k2) is assigned an arbitrary value (0.1 min-1).

guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF)- regulator of RhoGTPases. GEFs activate GTPases by promoting the exchange of GDP for GTP. GAPs inactivate GTPases by stimulating their intrinsic GTP-hydrolyzing activity.
Activation of GEF. The forward reaction rate parameter (k1) is assigned an arbitrary value (1 uM-1min-1).
The authors used 1 uM for the cellular concentration of the activator (arbitrary value).

This ModelBrick from the article, " Positive regulation of Rho GTPase activity by RhoGDIs as a result of their direct interaction with GAPs " describes the activation of GEF and the degradation of the activator. GDIs inhibit GEF and GAP activities by sequestering GTPase (kinetic law was adjusted to eliminate effect of GDI on both GEF and GAP).

guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF)- regulator of RhoGTPases. GEFs activate GTPases by promoting the exchange of GDP for GTP. GAPs inactivate GTPases by stimulating their intrinsic GTP-hydrolyzing activity. The authors used 0.31 uM for the cellular concentration of GEF (Aoki, 2007).
